intro: Galium umbellatum var. chlorophyllum, commonly known as the greenleaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, which are borne in umbels, giving it its species name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage is often noted for its bright green color, which distinguishes it from other varieties of Galium.
